clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Volitional Pursed-lips Breathing
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of PLB Physiology in COPD - Untersuchung Zur Physiologie Der Lippenbremse Bei COPD

lead_sponsor.agency: Karl Josef Franke, PD DR med

clinical_study.source: Institut für Pneumologie Hagen Ambrock eV

brief_summary.textblock: Simulation of pursed-lips breathing by defined stenoses in pulmonary function diagnostics to quantify the effect of the pursed-lips breathing

detailed_description.textblock: Since many years it is recommended for COPD patients to reduce the crossdiameter of the lips in order to improve the exhalation by means of so-called pursed-lips breathing (PLB). But the effects have never been studied quantitatively. In this study, the PLB effect is simulated during lung function diagnostics, using different sized resistors inserted into the routine mouthpiece of the flow sensor to resemble the effective airway resistances of a PLB maneuver. This prospective, randomized study includes 20 healthy subjects and 50 COPD patients, who will perform lung function testing with 4 different sized resistors.

primary_outcome.description: Measuring of lung function parameters with different resistors to simulate PLB unit: L, measured with der MasterScreen™ Body, CareFusion

secondary_outcome.description: unit: L, measured with der MasterScreen™ Body, CareFusion
unit: %, measured with der MasterScreen™ Body, CareFusion

arm_group.description: Lung-healthy subjects, randomized lung function testing
COPD patients, randomized lung function testing
COPD patients, randomized lung function testing
COPD patients, randomized lung function testing
COPD patients, randomized lung function testing

intervention.description: Lung function testing with MasterScreen™ Body, CareFusion Germany GmbH
Lung funtion testing with MasterScreen™ Body, CareFusion Germany GmbH, Mouthpiece with mesh-resistor (5hPa/L) to create laminar airflow
intervention.other_name: Rudolph Flow Resistance Standards; HANS RUDOLPH, Inc.

intervention.description: Lung funtion testing with MasterScreen™ Body, CareFusion Germany GmbH, Mouthpiece with mesh-resistor (10hPa/L) to create laminar airflow
intervention.other_name: Rudolph Flow Resistance Standards; HANS RUDOLPH, inc

intervention.description: Lung function testing with MasterScreen™ Body, CareFusion Germany GmbH, Mouthpiece with perforated resistor (inside diameter 7mm) to create a turbulent airflow
Lung function testing with MasterScreen™ Body, CareFusion Germany GmbH, Mouthpiece with perforated resistor (inside diameter 11mm) to create a turbulent airflow

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients:
- COPD (GOLD I- IV)
- Stable respiratory situation that allows routine lung funtion
- capable of communication
Healthy:
- Lung Healthy
- capable of communication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Invasive Ventilation
- Other serious acute physical illnesses that require immediate intensive medical treatment
- Acute hypercapnic decompensation with a pH < 7.35 in the capillary BGA
- Pregnancy or Nursing
- Not able to give consent
- Not willing or able to follow the study protocol

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Institut für Pneumologie Hagen Ambrock eV
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Karl Josef Franke, PD DR med
